page.title: 01Kedington & Nearby Parishes
page.content: The block under considration contains three main centres of population; those of Lt Wratting, Gt Wratting and kedington. The total population of the area is approximately 1930, 1600 residing in the village of kedington. The general nature of the landscape is open farmland, while the main topographical features are low hills and shallow valleys. The other main feature is the river Stour which ivides the are into two parts and is bounded for most of its length by water meadows. kedington to some extent serves as a dormer village for the nearby town of Haverhill which provides much of the employment and services, including recreational facilities, but excluding hospitals. Main employers within the block are an abbatoir and meat processing factory in Lt Wratting and a long stay mental
